result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Donald Keyser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:01 AM Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared.  PSI received, victims mother heard, state heard, defense counsel heard, defendant waives statement, court heard and sentence imposed.  

**8 yr IC in the WI state prison system to commence forthwith, not elgible for any programs
**5 yr ES
**court costs and supervision fees
**DNA sample/surcharge
**30 days of pre-sentence credit
of payment in full
Sentencing hearing on February 14, 2019 at 10:00 am.
guilty (not guilty unsigned)

DAY 3 - 8:29 - Defendant Raymond Donald Keyser in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mayer heard and defendant has chosen not to testify; Court questions def and reviews his right to testify; 8:35 jury returns; Court address jury; defense rests; all testimony has been entered; 8:43 jury removed; discussion re closings; 8:45 recess; jury instructions conference off the record;  8:54 reconvene; jury instruction conference; confusion in numbering of exhibits, 2 were marked 41 neither received, #41 Data for Hypozia & RH's is remarked to #44; Court will limit closing arguments to 1 hour each; 8:58 recess; 9:16 reconvene/jury brought in; Court gives jury instructions; State gives closing argument; Defense gives closing argument; State gives rebuttal argument; Court gives final jury instruction; alternates selected; bailiffs sworn; 10:51 jury out for deliberations; discussion; 10:53 recess;  12:56 jury brought in/reconvene; jury has reached a verdict; Court reads verdict - guilty; Court polls jury; Court addresses jury; 12:59 - jury discharged; Court heard and makes entry of conviction; discussion regarding bail; Court heard and will not revoke bond at this time; Court calls 16CF82 - State heard and moves to dismiss; Court orders 16CF82 dismissed; discussion held on sentencing date; Court orders PSI;

DAY 2 - AFTERNOON - 1:04 reconvene; discussion outside presence of jury; State will rest; defense motions to dismiss; Court heard and mtn is denied; 1:05 jury returns; State rests; Defense calls Dr Evan Matshes, sworn & testifies; 2:29 jury removed/recess; 2:39 jury returns/reconvene; Dr Matshes continues testimony; 4:17 jury taken out/recess; 4:30 jury returns/reconvene; State recalls Dr. Narang; 4:43 jury taken out; discussion; 4:45 recess until 8:30 am tomorrow

DAY 2 - Defendant Raymond Donald Keyser in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court heard, has concerns with juror #3 and #7 possibly sleeping during  trial yesterday.  Court questions jurors individually.  Court satisfied w/explanation provided.  Discussion on Detective Day's testimony yesterday.  Court has concerns w/statements made by Detective Day re: the incident could not happen the way the defendant reported and Dr. Knox sure the injuries were caused by abuse.  Attorney Mayer responds.  Attorney Klomberg heard.  Court heard, will address the statement in the jury instructions.  8:52 jury present.  Attorney Klomberg calls Dr. Sandeep Narang, S/T.  9:58 jury out/recess. 10:10 jury returns/reconvene; State continues with Dr. Narang's testimony; 10:41 jury taken out; Atty Mayer heard re Dr's testimony; discussion held; Court heard and sustains defense objection re statistical testimony; 10:50 jury returns; 12:15 jury removed/lunch recess;

DAY 1 - 8:28 - Defendant Raymond Donald Keyser in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held; victim's mother allowed to remain; parties heard on mtns in limine; discussion held on evidence filed late yesterday; Court heard and will reserve his ruling on Manifest Injustice; 9:15 jury panel brought in; Court addresses jury panel; jurors sworn; voir dire; 10:26 jury selected/sworn; Court releases remaining jury panel; Court addresses jury and give preliminary instructions; 10:33 jury taken out/recess; 10:45 reconvene; Court heard; juror brought in, says they feel sick; Court question juror #21; 10:50 jury panel brought in; Court addresses jury and gives opening instructions; State gives opening; Atty Mayer gives opening; Court reads parties stipulation re: ex 1; State calls Suzanne Reissmann, sworn & testifies; State calls Dep Ryan Schwartz, sworn & testifies; 12:02 jury taken out for lunch/recess; 12:35 jury brought in/reconvene; State continues testimoney of Dep Schwartz; State calls Det Kevin Day, sworn & testifies; witness ID's def; 1:38 jury taken out/recess; 1:51 jury returns/reconvene; 2:53 jury taken out/recess; 3:04 jury returns/reconvene; State calls Michelle Meyer, sworn & testifies; witness ID's def; 3:32 jury taken out; discussion re Ms. Meyer's testimony; Court orders questions re conviction not allowed; 3:38 jury returned; testimony continues; witness to be taken out of order defense calls David Voigt, sworn & testifies; Court will adjourn for the day; Court gives instructions for the overnight; 4:00 jury taken out; discussion held; 4:05 recess until 8:30 am tomorrow

Defendant, Raymond Donald Keyser in court,  Attorney Kathilynne Grotelueschen appeared for the State of Wisconsin Corp. Counsel. 15CF75, 16CF82 Defendant Raymond Donald Keyser in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested,waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $2,500.00 bond with conditions:  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

DA Klomberg appears for State. Atty Mayer appears for Def; Def FTA. Atty Mayer heard; lost contact w/defendant. Discussion held. Court heard, defendant now unemployed & not receiving payments on Court Appointed Counsel; Court forfeits bond and issues WA; Atty Mayer is discharged from case. Court notes any future requests for Court Appointed Counsel must be done with Judge Bauer ONLY.

re ex parte motion for funding for expert witnesses

Defendant Raymond Donald Keyser in court with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Mayer heard, had filed a Petition to gain funding to hire experts for Def., the court wanted FDS from Def. which was handed to court today. Atty Mayer further heard on the importance of hiring an expert for this matter. Ct. heard, Def. not paying $100 as previously ordered. Atty Mayer heard in response. Def. S/T. Court heard, not inclined to give Def. money for expert when Def. is not making a good faith effort to pay what is owed now for appointed attorney. Ct. heard, wants name/address of employer and SSN, will set up income w/h for $200 every two weeks, will re-examine Def's request at a later date. Atty Klomberg heard - State is ready to go to trial for the most part. Discussion held regarding JT, earliest would be June - to be set at later date.  Status conference scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:15 am.

12:49 - Defendant Raymond Donald Keyser in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn Shelton (not eligible).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1,000 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with ARM dob 6/8/14 & no in person contact with MKM w/f dob 2/24/86. No contact with ANY children under the age of 18.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.
